• Acquisition Completed: Cleanaway Waste Management Limited acquired Contract Resources Group Pty Ltd on 31 July 2025.

No further material information (e.g., deal size, funding structure, or financial impact) provided.

• Exploration Update:
  • Phase 1 drilling (1,500m RC) commenced at Dulcie Far North (DFN) targeting strike/depth extensions and new footwall lodes.
  • Phase 2 (9,000–12,000m RC) planned for H2 2025 to convert Exploration Target (0.3–0.8Moz gold) into inferred resources.

  • Existing DFN Inferred Resource: 8.2Mt at 1.2g/t Au (302koz).

  • Funding: Fully funded via recent rights issue (ASX 9 July 2025) to support aggressive H2 exploration.

No material trading or capital markets events identified (e.g., capital raising, liquidity changes).

Omitted: Operational details, timelines, management quotes, background project info.

• Contract Award: Downer awarded $220 million Defence contract (IWP) over a 4-year term (initial 2 years + 2x1-year options).
  • Scope: Professional services for Joint C4 Systems Branch under existing MSP contract, commencing 1 September 2025.

No material capital markets/trading impact identified (no raising, operational guidance, or liquidity event).

Material Information Summary:

  • Exploration Results:
  • Identified Southern Breccia Prospect (600m length, up to 170m width) with silicified brecciation and elevated copper/gold from rock chip sampling.
  • IP geophysical survey revealed two anomalies:
    • Southern anomaly (high chargeability, low resistivity) correlated with surface breccia.
    • Northern anomaly is a blind target under cover.

  • Historical drilling highlights:

    • 6m @ 1.99g/t Au, 1m @ 9.39g/t Au (MQD0001).
    • 26m @ 8.37g/t Au (BPH015, historical).

  • Next Steps:

  • Planned 1,000–2,000m RC drilling to test Southern Breccia and IP targets.

No capital markets action or trading halt requested. Operational update only.

No other material trading or capital markets information identified.

• 21st copper concentrate shipment: 1,563.9 WMT (wet metric tons) dispatched on 31 July 2025, containing ~263 MT copper and ~2.7 kg gold.
  • Production interruption: 10-day planned shutdown for SAG mill liner replacement (routine maintenance). Normal operations have resumed.
  • Recent production trends: Copper output increased sequentially (Parcel 19: 223.5 MT, Parcel 20: 237.4 MT, Parcel 21: 263 MT).

Note: No material capital markets or liquidity impacts identified (operational update only).

  • Issue details: ~33.3M SPP shares issued 1 Aug 2025, trading starts same day.
  • Use of funds: Expansion of Eloise plant & Jericho copper mine development.

Here’s the concise summary of material information from the ASX announcement:

Scoping Study Highlights (Queen Alexandra Gold Project)

  • Production Target (Stage 1 & 2 Pit):
  • 181kt @ 2.56 g/t Au, producing 13,700 oz gold (91% Indicated, 9% Inferred Resource).
  • Revenue: ~AU$65.6M over 10 months (gold price: AU$4,800/oz).
  • Pre-tax cash surplus: AU$14M–15M after AU$6M pre-mining capital.

  • Funding requirement: AU$21M–22M (includes working capital).

  • Key Metrics:

  • Breakeven gold price: ~AU$3,700/oz.
  • Sensitivity: Every +AU$100/oz gold price → +AU$1.4M revenue.

  • Toll milling: Discussions underway; potential 73kt high-grade ore (3.83 g/t Au) for early cashflow.

  • Upside (Stage 3 Pit):

  • Potential additional 1,700 oz gold (208kt @ 2.50 g/t Au) pending design/gold price.

  • Risks:

  • Inferred Resources: 9% of Production Target; low geological confidence.

  • Funding uncertainty: AU$21M–22M required; may involve dilution/JV.

  • Next Steps:

  • Geotechnical drilling, feasibility studies, and permitting (mining plan submission H1 2026).

Other Material Details

  • Redcastle Reef Project: Adjacent to QA (146kt @ 1.9 g/t Au); potential synergies.
  • No Ore Reserves declared – Study is preliminary (±35% cost accuracy).

Omitted: Routine operational details, chairman commentary, and non-material annexures.

Summary of Material Information:

  • New Exploration Project Granted: DeSoto awarded Reconnaissance Authorisation Permit (24396) for the Syncerus Gold Project (99.8km²) in Guinea’s Siguiri Basin.
  • Strategic Location: Syncerus is proximal to DeSoto’s Dabidiana Project and within a basin hosting multi-million-ounce deposits (e.g., 5.5Moz Bankan).
  • Exploration Plans: Immediate commencement of reconnaissance fieldwork; environmental surveys already submitted.
  • Existing Results Highlighted:
  • Dadjan: 10m @ 1.61 g/t Au, 4m @ 7.08 g/t Au.
  • Tole: 8m @ 18 g/t Au.
  • Portfolio Expansion: DeSoto now holds >1,000km² in the Siguiri Basin (see Table 1 for permit details).

No capital markets or liquidity-impacting announcements identified (e.g., capital raising, trading halt). Focus is exploration progress and resource potential.

No material information identified

(Note: This is a standard certification of interim filings with no substantive financial or operational disclosures. The actual financial statements and MD&A referenced in the announcement were not provided in the document.)

Material Information Summary for Trading & Capital Markets Decisions

1. Capital Raising & Financing (Key Updates)

  • Debt Refinancing:
  • Fully repaid $477M outstanding on the Mantoverde (MV) project finance facility ($334M Capstone share).

  • New $145M term loan for Mitsubishi Materials’ (MMC) 30% share, with a 2-year grace period.

  • Credit Facilities:

  • $1B revolving credit facility (RCF) amended, maturing May 2029 (previously $700M).
  • $600M in senior unsecured notes issued at 6.75% (due March 2033).
  • $795M undrawn RCF capacity as of June 30, 2025.

2. Operational & Financial Highlights (Q2 2025)

  • Production & Costs:
  • Copper production: 57,416 tonnes (Q2 2025) vs. 40,937 tonnes (Q2 2024), +40% YoY, primarily from MV sulphide ramp-up.
  • C1 cash costs: $2.45/lb (down from $2.80/lb YoY) due to higher output & lower unit costs.

  • Realized copper price: $4.39/lb ($4.53/lb in Q2 2024).

  • Financials:

  • Revenue: $543.2M (vs. $393.1M YoY).
  • Adj. EBITDA: $215.6M (vs. $123.1M YoY).
  • Net debt: $691.9M (down from $742.0M at Dec 2024).
  • Cash & liquidity: $311.6M cash + $795M undrawn RCF = $1.1B total liquidity.

3. Project Updates (Growth & Expansion)

  • Mantoverde Optimized (MV-O) Expansion:
  • Permit secured: DIA environmental approval received in July 2025.
  • Plan: Increase sulphide throughput (32k → 45k tpd), extend mine life (19 → 25 years).

  • Capital: $20M long-lead items approved; sanctioning decision expected Q3 2025.

  • Santo Domingo Project (Copper-Iron-Gold):

  • Feasibility Study (July 2024): $1.7B NPV (8%), 24.1% IRR (copper price: $4.10/lb).
  • Partnership: Advanced-stage discussions, announcement expected Q3 2025.

  • Capital: $2.3B initial capex (detailed engineering underway).

  • Cobalt Opportunity (MV-SD District):

  • Plan: 1,500 tpa cobalt initially (scalable to 4,500–6,000 tpa post-Santo Domingo).
  • Study completion: Late 2025.

4. 2025 Guidance Reiterated

  • Production: 220–255kt copper (H2-weighted due to mine sequencing).
  • Costs: C1 cash cost $2.20–$2.50/lb.
  • Capex: $315M sustaining/expansionary, $210M capitalized stripping, $25M exploration.

5. Key Risks & Catalysts Ahead

  • Pinto Valley challenges: Water constraints (Arizona drought); mitigation underway (full mill ops by Q3 2025).
  • Copper price volatility: Realized price $4.39/lb (Q2) vs. LME avg. $4.32/lb.
  • Sulphide ramp-up execution: MV and Mantos Blancos performing above plan.

Trading Takeaways:

✅ Bullish: Strong production growth, lower costs, solid liquidity, and strategic expansion (MV-O, Santo Domingo).
⚠️ Monitor: Execution risk on MV-O sanctioning, copper price trends, and near-term operational hiccups (Pinto Valley).

Conclusion: Capstone’s improved financial position and growth pipeline position it favorably, but market sensitivity to copper prices and project timelines remains key.

Capstone Copper Q2 2025 Results – Material Highlights

Operational & Financial Performance

  • Record copper production: 57,416 tonnes in Q2 2025 (up 40% YoY), with C1 cash costs of $2.45/lb (down 12% YoY).
  • Sulphide production surge: 47,086 tonnes (up 55% YoY), driven by Mantoverde sulphides (16,507 tonnes at $1.51/lb).
  • Net income: $24.0M ($0.03/share), vs. $29.3M in Q2 2024. Adjusted EBITDA hit a record $215.6M (vs. $123.1M YoY).
  • Liquidity & debt: Net debt reduced to $691.9M (from $788.1M Q1 2025); total liquidity at $1,106.6M ($311.6M cash + $795M undrawn credit).

2025 Guidance Reiterated

  • Copper production: 220,000–255,000 tonnes at C1 cash costs of $2.20–$2.50/lb.
  • Capital expenditure:
  • Sustaining/expansionary: $315M
  • Capitalized stripping: $210M
  • Exploration: $25M

Key Updates

  1. Mantoverde Optimized (MV-O) Project:
  2. Received final environmental permit (DIA).
  3. Targets increase to 45,000 tpd throughput (from 32,000 tpd) and extends mine life to 25 years.

  4. Board sanction decision expected in Q3 2025.

  5. Santo Domingo Project (Feasibility Study Highlights):

  6. After-tax NPV (8%): $1.7B | IRR: 24.1%.
  7. Initial capex: $2.3B; first-quartile costs of $0.28/lb Cu (first 7 years).

  8. Partnership announcement expected in Q3 2025; sanctioning not before mid-2026.

  9. Cobalt Opportunity:

  10. Plans for 1,500 tpa cobalt production (scaling to 4,500–6,000 tpa post-Santo Domingo).

Trading Implications

  • Bullish: Record production, cost reductions, and strong liquidity position.
  • Catalysts: MV-O sanction (Q3), Santo Domingo partner (Q3), and cobalt project updates.

No capital raising or material corporate actions announced. Focus remains on operational execution and growth projects.

Here’s the concise extraction of material information for capital markets and trading decisions:

Financial Highlights (Unaudited) – June 30, 2025

  • Revenue:
  • Q2 2025: $543.2M (vs. $393.1M in Q2 2024).
  • H1 2025: $1,076.5M (vs. $733.0M in H1 2024).
  • Net Income:
  • Q2 2025: $30.0M (vs. $27.5M in Q2 2024).
  • H1 2025: $28.9M (vs. $21.7M in H1 2024).
  • EPS:
  • Basic & diluted: $0.03 (Q2 2025), $0.02 (H1 2025).

Balance Sheet & Liquidity

  • Cash & Equivalents: $310.8M (vs. $131.6M at Dec 2024).
  • Total Debt: $928.8M (long-term) + $670.9M (current liabilities).
  • Net Debt: ~$1.29B (total debt minus cash).

Capital Structure Updates

  1. Senior Unsecured Notes:
  2. Issued $600M at 6.75% (March 2025), due 2033.
  3. Used to repay MVDP Facility ($477.5M repaid in June 2025).
  4. Revolving Credit Facility (RCF):
  5. Increased to $1.0B (May 2025), maturing 2029.
  6. Interest: SOFR + 1.75–2.75%.
  7. Mantoverde Term Loan:
  8. $145M secured (June 2025), maturing 2032.

Operational Metrics

  • Production Costs: $308.8M (Q2 2025).
  • Capital Expenditures: $180.0M (Q2 2025), primarily at Mantoverde/Pinto Valley.

Derivatives & Hedging

  • Outstanding Hedges:
  • Copper collars (15.5kt at $4.15–$4.83/lb).
  • FX hedges (CLP, CAD, MXN).
  • MTM Loss: $(5.3M) on derivatives.

Key Risks/Catalysts

  • Minto Obligation: $17.9M current liability for reclamation.
  • Gold Stream Liability: $10.7M (Santo Domingo delay payment).

Segment Performance (Q2 2025)

  • Mantoverde: Strongest performer ($27.4M net income).
  • Pinto Valley: Net loss ($0.8M) due to higher costs.

Other Material Updates

  • Sierra Norte Acquisition: Closed Aug 2024 ($40M shares issued).
  • ESG-Linked Financing: Adjusted RCF includes sustainability terms.

Actionable Takeaways:
- Liquidity improved post-debt refinancing (cash up 136% H1 2025).
- Watch copper price volatility and FX impacts (CLP/MXN).
- Senior Notes reduce near-term refinancing risk but increase leverage.

No dividend or buyback announcements.

• Executive Incentive Plan: 60 million performance rights issued (30m each to two executives), subject to shareholder approval (GM expected September 2025).
  • Vesting Conditions: Rights vest only if 60-day VWAP reaches:
  • Tranche A: $0.60 (100% above current price) – 12-month tenure.
  • Tranche B: $0.80 (167% above) – 24-month tenure.
  • Tranche C: $1.00 (233% above) – 36-month tenure.
  • Salary Freeze: Executives to forgo base salary increases and additional equity grants for 5 years.

No material impact on capital structure or liquidity; dilution contingent on share price outperformance.

• Change of Director’s Interest (Appendix 3Y)
  • Director: Ian Thomas Huntley
  • Date of Change: 30 & 31 July 2025
  • Securities Acquired: 137,000 ordinary fully paid shares
  • Transaction Value: $249,596 (on-market trade)
  • Total Holdings Post-Change: 12,156,352 ordinary shares (across direct/indirect interests).

No material trading or capital markets impact identified (routine director interest disclosure).

• Revenue milestone: FY revenue exceeded $200M for the first time ($208M total sales).
  • Core market strength: Australasia delivered $181M in sales, supporting $300M FY27 revenue target.
  • North American expansion:
  • Launched Maxigesic IV/tablet (Combogesic) in the US and Canada (combined addressable market >US$8B).
  • Restructured US distribution to optimize postoperative care sales.
  • Pipeline progress:
  • 8 patented products in R&D, 24 off-patent injectables, and 5 advanced programs entering commercialization (e.g., Crystaderm, Micolette).
  • Financials:
  • Net debt reduced to $14.5M (from $16.2M).
  • Dividend increased to 1.8 cents/share (from 1.6 cents).
  • Share price concerns: Management believes the share price undervalues growth potential and pipeline.
  • Challenges: FY25 saw temporary headwinds (client destocking, doctors’ strike), but H2 recovery occurred.

No material capital markets actions (e.g., raising, trading halts) identified.

Summary of ASX Announcement: AFT Pharmaceuticals 2025 Annual Shareholders' Meeting Presentation

Key Financial Highlights

  • FY25 Revenue: NZ$208.0M (+6% YoY), with 5-year CAGR of 14%.
  • ANZ Sales: NZ$180.9M (87% of total).
  • Operating Profit: NZ$17.6M (down from NZ$24.2M in FY24) due to lower license income and strategic investments.
  • Dividend: 1.8cps (up from 1.6cps in FY24).
  • Net Debt: NZ$14.5M (down from NZ$16.2M in FY24).
  • FY27 Target: Revenue of NZ$300M.

Operational & Strategic Updates

  • International Expansion:
  • Products sold in ~80 countries; active R&D pipeline of 8 patented products.
  • Launches in UK/EU (Combogesic IV), North America, Asia, and Africa.
  • R&D Progress:
  • 24+ injectable products and 5 commercialized R&D programs; key focus on Maxigesic variants (oral/IV) and dermatology (Crystaderm).
  • Market-Specific Performance:
  • Australia: +17% growth (eyecare/pain relief).
  • Asia: Disrupted by Korean doctors’ strike.

Outlook

  • FY26 operating profit guidance: NZ$20M–NZ$24M.
  • Focus on geographic and product diversification to drive growth.

No capital raising, trading halt, or material M&A disclosed.
